item.title: Podman auto-update on CoreOS
item.description: If you want to enable the podman auto-update systemd timer on Fedora CoreOS for rootless containers, check out the Butane config below: variant: fcos version: 1.5.0 passwd: users: - name: core ssh_authorized_keys: - ssh-rsa CHANGEME - name: penguin storage: files: - path: /home/penguin/.config/containers/systemd/hello-world.container contents: inline: | [Unit] Description=hello-world [Container] AutoUpdate=registry Image=hello-world Network=host [Install] WantedBy=default.target links: - path: /home/penguin/.config/systemd/user/timers.target.wants/podman-auto-update.timer target: /usr/lib/systemd/user/podman-auto-update.timer user: name: penguin group: name: penguin

item.title: Deploying Nightscout with CoreOS
item.description: Introduction Nightscout is an open source cloud application used by people with diabetes to visualize, store and share the data from their Continuous Glucose Monitoring sensors in real-time. It can also send push notifications and trigger webhooks through integrations such as IFTTT. Fedora CoreOS is a minimal operating system made for running containers. It can be configured to automatically fetch security updates and newer container images. This guide helps you deploy Nightscout to the platform of your choice with CoreOS.

item.title: Dell PowerEdge T150 Memory
item.description: TLDR; buy this -> Kingston Server Premier 32GB 2933MHz Memory Why As of 2022-04-10, 128GB of ram from dell.com will cost you $2,540.28 USD. This is more than you need to spend for certified ram, but don’t rush to buy what you think might be compatible. Dell claims the T150 supports 128gb of memory, and 3200mhz memory, just not together.
